Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Volume_PDS3.archive_status_note: The database contains a value of NULL. For the purposes of this exercise, the value was replaced with IN_QUEUE
Volume_PDS3.volume_name: APOLLO 15 HEAT FLOW THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY RDR SUBSAMPLED DATA
Volume_PDS3.description: This data set comprises a reduced, subsampled set of the data returned from the Apollo 15 Heat Flow Experiment from 31 July 1971 through 31 December 1974. The experiment consisted of two probes placed by the Apollo 15 astronauts in holes drilled in the lunar surface near the Apollo 15 Lunar Surface Experiments Package site to measure the thermal conductivity. The data consist of a set of ten ASCII tables with time, temperature differences, and average temperatures readings measured by the thermocouples in the heat flow probes and probe cables. The data have been restored and reformatted from binary data held on magnetic tapes at the NASA National Space Science Data Center (NSSDC) under NSSDC ID of PSPG-00093 (old NSSDC ID 71-063C-06A).
